channel.title: Linux on Raihan Khan
channel.description: Recent content in Linux on Raihan Khan

item.title: Linux File Systems
item.description: Directory Structure The directories help us to store the files and locate them when we need them. Also, directories are called folders as they can be assumed of as folders where files reside in the form of a physical desktop analogy. Directories can be organized in a tree-like hierarchy in Linux and several other operating systems. The directory structure of Linux is well-documented and defined in the Linux FHS (Filesystem Hierarchy Standard).
